summary: This is an email chain from October 26, 2020, between FBI personnel and a NYPD detective regarding forensic examination of hard drives seized from a Seagate path. The emails discuss sending photos of the hard drives and coordinating a call to finalize a warrant for judicial approval.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: The individual is asked to send photos of hard drives taken during forensic examination and is coordinating a call with the FBI.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Officer
persons.context: The detective is involved in the investigation, needs approval to send a warrant to a judge, and is coordinating with forensic examiners.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
persons.context: The special agent is part of the email chain, involved in reviewing the warrant and coordinating the forensic examination process.

connections.person1: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.person2: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Officer
connections.description: Coordinating on forensic examination of hard drives and warrant preparation for a child exploitation/human trafficking investigation.

connections.person1: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.person2: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
connections.description: Communicating about sending photos of hard drives and scheduling a call related to the investigation.

connections.person1: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Officer
connections.person2: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
connections.description: Working together on a child exploitation/human trafficking case, with the detective needing the agent's go-ahead for a warrant.

events.title: Coordination for hard drive forensic photos and warrant
events.description: FBI personnel and a NYPD detective coordinate via email to obtain photos of seized hard drives and finalize a warrant for judicial approval.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Officer
Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from October 26, 2020, related to an FBI/NYPD child exploitation and human trafficking investigation.
It references forensic examination of 9 Seagate path 100 hard drives, with a request for photos of the drives.
A warrant is being prepared and needs approval from the FBI before being sent to a judge.
The communication highlights coordination between forensic examiners, detectives, and special agents in a time-sensitive manner.
